txt.en: 'Look, [placeholder]! Floodwend still stands!\n\n'The Easterlings are truly driven off. I cannot thank you enough for helping us here, my friend. Look at my people, whole and hale.'

'We could not have managed this without you, [placeholder]. I owe you so much. I do not think I would have embraced my responsibilities with such confidence if you had not been here to show me the way a true leader, a true warrior, must be.'
Instance: Floodwend Besieged

'We could not have managed this without you, [placeholder]. I owe you so much. I do not think I would have embraced my responsibilities with such confidence if you had not been here to show me the way a true leader, a true warrior, must be.'
Radwig shows great courage for one so young. You must ready yourself for an attack on the Mead Hall.
The sounds of battle grow louder. The forces of Mordor are not far!
The Mead Hall is safe at last
The town of Floodwend is besieged by the forces of Jóshkhin Orda, led by the Grim Southron who re-grouped the routed army.\n\nYou must protect the Mead Hall, and the young Thane of Floodwend!
You let Radwig die!
Radwig is in the Mead Hall of Floodwend, awaiting the approach of the forces of Mordor, let by the Grim Southron.
You let Etta die!
Radwig is in the Mead Hall of Floodwend.
The Mead Hall of Floodwend has been defended, and Radwig is excited to congratulate you, and thank you for your help.
The Mead Hall of Floodwend has been defended, and Radwig is excited to congratulate you, and thank you for your help.

Speak with the young Thane
Listen to Radwig
Protect the Mead Hall from the forces of Mordor

<rgb=#FF0000>Radwig cannot be defeated</rgb>
<rgb=#FF0000>Etta cannot be defeated</rgb>

<rgb=#FF0000>Etta cannot be defeated</rgb>
Floodwend's peril has come to a boil. The Orcs and Easterlings have advanced on Floodwend, lead by the Nazgûl: the Grim Southron.

'It is time to brace for battle, [placeholder]. I can already hear the sounds of war outside. We must take a stand here, in this very Mead Hall, and ensure that it does not fall as Langhold did, not many days ago.'
